title: IMac GPU
message: Hello and good evening, I got a a1311 emc 2389 iMac that was PACKED with dust. GPU is fucked, few secs after turning on I get pink stripes. Should I get into this, replace the GPU and all? (I don't even know what chip does it mount) is it worth my time or is it junk? (Mostly, can I find new chips?)

title: IMac GPU
message: im going to say junk, check aliexpress but id say the customer wont want to pay the replacement cost, maybe offer data recovery

title: IMac GPU
message: Well it got a working hdd, data recovery is out, customer is a software house that prefers to fix this instead of buying a new one. I'm still debating if I should take it or tell em to buy a new one instead

title: IMac GPU
message: Probably a 216-0729051 chip. I am going to make a VBIOS mod so 0729042 can be used, that chip has better availability. Still very annoying to source these GPUs.

title: IMac GPU
message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 19434"]Probably a 216-0729051 chip. I am going to make a VBIOS mod so 0729042 can be used, that chip has better availability. Still very annoying to source these GPUs.[/QUOTE]

Hi Duke,

This will be most welcome. Maybe a bit of a cheeky question, any hints on how to decompress the efi ?

title: IMac GPU
message:
This looks like fun. Thanks duke

I will check that graphics card tomorrow

title: IMac GPU
message: Damn.....uncompressing the EFI is a real headache.....im still trying :(

title: IMac GPU
message: OT: found the original chip, lead free bga chips are shithell to work with. but it's working, tag as solved

title: IMac GPU
message: The date 1506 ones are fake if those are the ones you used.

title: IMac GPU
message: i know, but i bought these face to face from a guy near here that hold a good stock of old (new) shit. these were lead free, the package seemed legit and it's working fine. date was 1035 or something, honestly i don't remember.
